1.name: A Trip to the Moon
1.description: A group of astronomers go on an expedition to the Moon.

2.name: A Gay Old Boy

3.name: Jack and the Beanstalk
3.description: Porter's sequential continuity editing links several shots to form a narrative of the famous fairy tale story of Jack and his magic beanstalk. Borrowing on cinematographic methods ...                See full summary »

5.name: Le voyage de Gulliver à Lilliput et chez les géants
5.description: Gulliver washes ashore on Lilliput, the inhabitants of which are no more than six inches tall. He later travels to Brobdingnag, a country populated by giants.

8.name: Loie Fuller
8.description: A simple serpentine dance by Fuller.

9.name: Ali Baba et les quarante voleurs
9.description: An early adaptation of the Ali Baba tale.

10.name: The Little Match Seller
10.description: In front of a windowless, soot-blackened brick wall on a snowy evening, a young girl wearing one shoe, a dress, and apron, tries to sell matches. She has no buyers. A cheeky lad comes by ...                See full summary »

11.name: Uncle Josh at the Moving Picture Show
11.description: Country rube thinks what he sees on the movie screen is real. He jumps out of his seat to try to stop a kissing scene.

12.name: B.F. Keith's New Million Dollar Theatre
12.description: Picture shows the placing of one of the large steel roof trusses.

13.name: Japanese Girl Smoking Cigarettes
13.description: A perfect likeness of a pretty little Japanese girl engaged in a national dissipation, that of cigarette smoking. The picture is very amusing, as the young lady puffs the cigarette smoke ...                See full summary »

15.name: The Coronation of Edward VII
15.description: A re-enactment using actors of the recent coronation of Britain's King Edward VII.

16.name: How They Do Things on the Bowery
16.description: Scene Bowery. Young woman drops her handkerchief while passing a Rube. He picks it up and gives it to her. She induces him to go into a side door of a saloon. Second scene, saloon. Rube and...                See full summary »

17.name: Samson et Dalila
17.description: This picture describes the well-known biblical story of Samson and Delila. The picture commences with Samson's visit to Gaza, a city of the Philistines. While there they closed the gates ...                See full summary »

18.name: Les chiens savants
18.description: A woman performs a music hall act with her extremely well-trained dogs.

19.name: Éruption volcanique à la Martinique
19.description: This picture depicts the eruption of the volcano by which over 30,000 souls were hurled into eternity. The numerous explosions which took place during the eruption are plain to be seen. ...                See full summary »

23.name: La douche du colonel
23.description: Two painters are working just above a group of soldiers, just as the commanding officer enters. One little slip with a paint bucket, and hilarity ensues.

25.name: Capture of the Biddle Brothers
25.description: The public throughout the world is acquainted with the sensational capture of the Biddle Brothers and Mrs. Soffel, who, through the aid of Mrs. Soffel, escaped from the Pittsburg jail on ...                See full summary »

26.name: La fée printemps
26.description: A couple invites an old lady at home, after having seen her outside under the snow. The lady turns into a fairy and cast a spell to transform the winter season by spring.

27.name: A Mermaid Dance
27.description: This is a double-printing trick picture, made of Annabelle, the American skirt dancer, and a German aquarium scene. The combined effect is very amusing, inasmuch as the dance appears to ...                See full summary »

28.name: L'homme mouche
28.description: An energetic Russian Cossack dancer who knows how to impress his audience with his extraordinary set of moves has a trick up his sleeve designed to capture applause.

30.name: Christening and Launching Kaiser Wilhelm's Yacht 'Meteor'
30.description: At the christening and launching, our cameras occupied a most enviable position, being within ten feet of Miss Alice Roosevelt and Prince Henry at the time the bottle was broken. The scene ...                See full summary »

31.name: Starting a Skyscraper
31.description: Taken in the immense excavation for the foundation of the new Macy building at the corner of Broadway and 34th Street, New York. An excellent study of modern American push and enterprise.

38.name: How to Stop a Motor Car
38.description: This is a very amusing picture taken on a picturesque country road in England, showing the efforts of the village constables to stop speeding of automobiles through the village. First is ...                See full summary »

39.name: Une indigestion

40.name: M. le Président de la République sur la Jetée Promenade
40.description: President Émile Loubet takes a walk with his suite.

41.name: Aunt Jane and the Tobasco Sauce
41.description: A man dressed as an old woman is sitting at a small table and being served a dish of food by a waiter. During the course of the meal, the food is heavily seasoned with Tabasco, so that the ...                See full summary »

43.description: This picture, taken at the athletic games of the One Hundredth Anniversary of the U. S. Military Academy, shows Daly, formerly of Harvard, and one of the star football players of the ...                See full summary »

44.name: Belles of the Beach
44.description: Two fair swimmers in an exciting race.

46.name: A Fight with Sledgehammers
46.description: Two rival blacksmiths fight over a woman, using sledgehammers.

47.name: Procesión de las hijas de María de la parroquia de Sans

48.name: A Tough Dance
48.description: Kid Foley and Sailor Lil doing the popular dance of the Bowery in which they claim to be the champions.

49.name: Burning of Durland's Riding Academy
49.description: This picture shows the fire at its height, the firemen playing water on the buildings, and the falling walls of one of the large stones. - from the Edison Catalog
